title: Intertwined order of generalized global symmetries
abstract:
We investigate the interplay of generalized global symmetries in 2+1
dimensions by introducing a lattice model that couples a $\mathbb{Z}_N$ clock
model to a $\mathbb{Z}_N$ gauge theory via a topological interaction. This
coupling binds the charges of one symmetry to the disorder operators of the
other, and when these composite objects condense, they give rise to emergent
generalized symmetries with mixed 't Hooft anomalies. These anomalies result in
phases with ordinary symmetry breaking, topological order, and
symmetry-protected topological (SPT) order, where the different types of order
are not independent but intimately related. We further explore the gapped
boundary states of these exotic phases and develop theories for phase
transitions between them. Additionally, we extend our lattice model to
incorporate a non-invertible global symmetry, which can be spontaneously
broken, leading to domain walls with non-trivial fusion rules.
